body:
I'm not sure why that's happening -- this is the first instance reporting this issue.

I have looked into the code that's responsible for that portion, and I'm still not quite sure why the process was stuck in a loop. I'll continue investigating and make sure this bug is resolved.

Unfortunately, Video2X currently doesn't have the ability to continue its work from extracted frames. **However**, it's totally possible. **However again**, it will take me probably quite some time to write this feature, since it's exam week right now. If you want a number, at least 4 days.
I have now backed up all the upscaled images so it's fine. Take your time. Thanks
I'll try it again in a few days and get back

> @Senjar sorry for all this waiting. A lot of things happened this past month.
> 
> Could you please verify that the problem still exists in 2.10.X?
> I looked over the code, and I didn't find why it could be failing.

When I try to go on this link: https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/releases

It is written that latest one is 2.9.0. I do not have option to download 2.10.X and btw I have exactly same problem with 2.9.0 like Senjar.

@OldClassicGamer The releases page contain Windows executable releases (EXE files), however, they are usually not up-to-date.

To obtain the newest version, use the Python version by cloning or downloading the zip file of the repository directly, and launch with a Python interpreter.

> @OldClassicGamer The releases page contain Windows executable releases (EXE files), however, they are usually not up-to-date.
> 
> To obtain the newest version, use the Python version by cloning or downloading the zip file of the repository directly, and launch with a Python interpreter.

Sadly I don't know how to deal without GUI so I guess I will wait for future update of 2.10.X GUI

I also just got the error message while reading this page... unlucky me.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15605513/64755295-83783700-d4df-11e9-9989-d3153af47a85.png)

@ItsSK you just ran out of memory, see the 4th line.
Reduce the number of threads. 1 should be enough. Too many won't really help for w2x.
Ran out of memory in GPU or system memory? because both were low. (below 50%)

> 
> 
> Ran out of memory in GPU or system memory? because both were low. (below 50%)

GPU (CUDA) memory.

> > Ran out of memory in GPU or system memory? because both were low. (below 50%)
> 
> GPU (CUDA) memory.

I restarted the process with 1 thread. But that "_out of _memory_" error happened before running for 5 hours. so then was it running somewhere else, or still in GPU memory? or why didn't the program crash when it ran out of memory?
I have discovered what caused me error. The program does not want to work with mkv format for some reason despite the fact that my PC has all codecs needed to play mkv files.

If I what I recall is right, MKV can use may codecs, e.g. H.264, H.265, mpeg-4.
Send a screenshot if you want me to take a look at it.

Seems to be fixed or at least I can't reproduce it in 2.10.0
You can close this issue.
